definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Those living in the shadow of stigma.
sentences.chinese: 這些人生活在污名的陰影中。

sentences.english: TB engenders social stigma in countries where it is widespread.
sentences.chinese: 在結核病流行國家中，它帶來的是社會污名。

sentences.english: The stigma of Watts was too heavy to bear.
sentences.chinese: 瓦茨的污名令人難忍受。

sentences.english: Because of one minor offence he was branded as a common criminal.
sentences.chinese: 由於一個輕罪，他被加上臭名昭著的罪犯的污名。

sentences.english: He vowed to clear his name.
Because of one insignificant offence he was branded a common criminal.
sentences.chinese: 由於一次輕微的過錯他蒙受了普通刑事犯的污名。

sentences.english: There is still a huge stigma attached to having a mental illness.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的污名仍高懸在精神疾病患者頭上。

sentences.english: From then on he was branded as traitor.
sentences.chinese: 從那以後他被加上賣國賊的污名。

sentences.english: "All Muslims are stigmatized (4) by this law, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 所有的穆斯林都因爲這項法律而被污名化了。

sentences.english: Even the worst of Islamism has not been a barrier.
sentences.chinese: 即使是被污名化的穆斯林也未影響伊斯蘭教的傳播。

sentences.english: Watch for flashes of anger or a sense that a group you belong to is being denigrated.
sentences.chinese: 要注意怒氣，或察覺你所屬團體正被污名化。

definition: to spit on and curse/to revile
to be wronged/to be subjected to an injustice
to reverse a verdict/to present different views on a historical person or verdict
